meanings.sent1: The students decided to coenact a play for the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: The committee will coenact new rules for the organization.
meanings.sent3: The animals coenacted a plan to escape from the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The team coenacted a strategy to win the championship.
meanings.sent5: The friends coenacted a surprise party for their friend's birthday.

meanings.definition: To make a law or decree in conjunction with others.
meanings.sent1: The senators coenact a bill to improve healthcare for all citizens.
meanings.sent2: The council will coenact regulations to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The family coenacted a rule to take turns doing chores.
meanings.sent4: The leaders coenacted a policy to promote equality in the community.
meanings.sent5: The group coenacted a resolution to address the issue of homelessness.
